intro: Conchocarpus longipes, commonly known as the longipes sea grape, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa and Namibia. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruit is a distinctive, elongated capsule that splits open to release seeds. This species is adapted to saline and arid environments, making it a hardy plant found in coastal dunes and sandy soils.
